(45) 340.V7th December, 1945.CABINET.COMMITTEE ON EXTERNAL ECONOMIC POLICY AND OVERSEASTRADE.Note by the Secretary of the Cabinet.IN accordance with the decision of the Cabinet on the 13th November, 1945,*the Prime Minister has appointed a Committee with the following terms ofreference : -'' To keep under regular review the development of the export trade, andto consider such general questions of external economic policy as arise fromthis review, or may be referred to it, reporting as may be necessary to theCabinet or the appropriate Ministerial Committee through the Presidentof the Board of Trade."2. The composition of the Committee is as follows : Secretary of Overseas Trade (Chairman).Parliamentary TJncler-Secretary of State, Foreign Office.Financial Secretary to the Treasury.Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State, Dominions Office.Parliamentarjr Under-Secretary of State, India Office and BurmaOffice.Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State, Colonial Office.Parliamentary Secretary, Ministry of Labour.Parliamentary Secretary, Ministry of Supply and of Aircraft Pro-duction (Mr. Woodburn).Parliamentary Secretary, Ministry of War Transport.Other interested Departments will be informed of the proceedings of theCommittee and will be given an opportunity of being represented at discussionsaffecting their interests.3. The Secretaries of the Committee are : Mr. G. E. Preston, Board of Trade.Mr. A. N. Coleridge, Lord Presidents Office.4. As a result of the appointment of this Committee, the Prime minister has decided to abolish the Overseas Economic Policy committee and to dis-charge the Lord Presidents (Industrial) Sub-Committee from its second termof reference, under which it is charged with keeping under review the develop-ment of the export trade.(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES.Cabinet Office, S. W. 1,17th December, 1945.* CM. (45) 52nd Conclusions, Minute 3.f See CP. (45) 110, page 5.[31054]
